statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 1 \\ 3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -1 \\ -6 \\ 11 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -14 \\ 1 \\ -9 \\ 19 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -4 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 1 \\ 3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ -1 \\ -6 \\ 11 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -14 \\ 1 \\ -9 \\ 19 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -4 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
